title: New Folder Structure for Content
body:
Implement a new folder structure for content to allow for clearer attribution and more effective/consistent grouping of related gameplay systems.
The new folder structure should apply in call content folders and allow for forks to clearly and easily differentiate their content from upstream or other fork contents they might be using. It should also make it easier for inexperienced contributors to find code that is related to specific gameplay systems.

This structure should be migrated to over time to minimize breaking changes.
author: Jezithyr

comments.body: What are we hoping for this to look like?

All new content we develop should go in either the AlphaParadox, _AlphaParadox, or APCore folders instead of in a root project. Instead of directly modifying upstream files, the class should be made partial and a new file containing those edits/additions should be created in the appropriate folder.

Originally I considered moving all upstream content into its own root-folder as well but that would just be creating merge conflicts and make fork migration harder. If/when we end up diverging to the point of no longer regularly pulling/merging from wizden then we can revisit that but for now it will just cause headaches when integrating upstream changes or for forks trying to migrate.
TLDR: Folder structure is setup for most of the projects, if you end up needing to create/modify code in a project that does not have our own root-folder, then create an _APCore folder for your code.
